nodes.text: A Council visibly moving toward authorizing force is the last remote hope of getting Iraq to disarm peacefully
he does not plan to carry out Mr. Blix's order to destroy missiles that exceed performance limits set by the U.N.

If Saddam is still not moving to comply with demands that he disarm peacefully and the Council has done everything to get him to do so short of visibly moving to authorize force only visibly moving to authorize force might get him to disarm peacefully
The UN has done everything short of visibly moving to use force to get Saddam to disarm peacefully.
Saddam Hussein reinforced that point himself yesterday by telling Dan Rather of CBS News that Iraqi missiles do not violate U.N. restrictions.
If Saddam still claims not to be violating UN resolutions he still does not plan to comply with its demand that he disarm peacefully
